ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Someone take me under their wing!
ygData.msgSnippet: Ah... too bad about the buddy key thing. As for getting my sis the game itself, I know she wouldn t be too hip on that right away, even though there s still a
ygData.messageBody:
Ah... too bad about the buddy key thing. As for
getting my sis the game itself, I know she wouldn't be
too hip on that right away, even though there's still
a free 30 day trial. She wouldn't want to buy the CD's
without trying the game first. She's funny like that,
hehe.

--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:
> I have 2 EverQuest accounts, I should have received
> a key for both of them but for the life of m I cant
> find the emails. My guess is that my spam filter
> ate them before I ever knew I had them. Oh well! :(
> So I'd like to know if this is possible as well.
> I'm not sweating it though cause I dont really have
> any friends whom I would give the keys to, they'd
> just go to waste. However, I do have the EverQuest
> Evolutions pack unopened. I was goign to set up a
> 3rd account once I got another computer powerful
> enough to run it. But I may end up selling it to
> someone or giving it away as a gift if I come across
> anyone who might want to start playing.
>
>
> Wulfric
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Melanie Johnson
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, June 21, 2004 12:34 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Someone take me under
> their wing!
>
>
> I was wondering if anyone knows if there is a way
> to
> request one of these keys? I have an EQ acount
> already, but I believe it must have been inactive
> when
> they first sent the buddy keys out. I recently
> re-subscribed at the first of June, so I'm not
> sure
> when these keys came out. I was kind of hoping to
> get
> one for my sister. :)
>
> Thanks
>
